quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Electricity and Magnetism
quiz.subtitle: Unit 9, Quiz 12: Force on a Current-Carrying Wire
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A 2.0 m long wire carries a current of 5.0 A through a 0.40 T magnetic field. If the wire is perpendicular to the field, what is the magnitude of the magnetic force?
A horizontal wire carries a current toward the right. It is placed in a magnetic field directed into the page. What is the direction of the magnetic force on the wire?
options: Toward the top of the page.
Toward the bottom of the page.
questions.explanation: Using the RHR: Thumb points right (current), fingers point into the page (field). The palm faces the top of the page (force).

questions.question: Under which orientation will a current-carrying wire experience the MAXIMUM magnetic force?
options: The wire is perpendicular to the magnetic field lines.
The wire is parallel to the magnetic field lines.
The wire is at a 45° angle to the field lines.
The wire is curved into a circle.
questions.explanation: Maximum force occurs when the wire is perpendicular (90°) because sin(90°) = 1. If parallel (0°), the force is zero.

questions.question: If the current through a wire is doubled and the external magnetic field is halved, what happens to the force on the wire?
questions.explanation: Since F ∝ BIL, doubling current (2I) and halving the field (0.5B) results in 2 * 0.5 = 1, keeping the force constant.

questions.question: A 15 cm wire section in a motor experiences a 3.0 N force when 8.0 A of current flows. What is the strength of the magnetic field (perpendicular)?
Two parallel wires carry current in the SAME direction. What is the nature of the magnetic force between them?
options: There is no force between them.
questions.explanation: Wires with parallel currents attract; wires with anti-parallel (opposite) currents repel.

questions.question: A vertical wire carries current downward. If the magnetic field is directed toward the East, what is the direction of the force?
questions.explanation: Using RHR: Thumb points Down, fingers point Right (East). The palm points toward you, which corresponds to South.

questions.question: The force on a wire is 10 N when it is perpendicular to a field. What is the force if the wire is rotated to an angle of 30° to the field?
A wire of length L carries current I. If it is formed into a coil with N turns, the total force on the coil in a uniform field is:
options: Proportional to the number of turns N.
Independent of the number of turns.
questions.explanation: Each turn adds another length of wire L into the field, so total force = N * BIL.

questions.question: Which device primarily relies on the magnetic force acting on a current-carrying wire to function?
questions.explanation: Electric motors use the force on current loops in a magnetic field to generate torque and mechanical rotation.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent — you've mastered the Motor Principle and directional force vectors.
scoreMessages.70: Solid performance — review your Right-Hand Rule applications for wire force.
scoreMessages.50: Good start — remember to convert units (like cm to m) before calculating F = BIL.
scoreMessages.0: Review the relationship between current, field direction, and physical force.
